questions.question:
What is this number in figures?

five thousand, one hundred and nine.

A ship symbol stands for 12 ships.

Look at the table showing:
- Dock A: 1 ship symbol
- Dock B: 1.5 ship symbols
- Dock C: 0.5 ship symbols

How many more ships are in dock A than dock C?

What is the value of the 7 in this number?

7240

The hills are at (3, 4).

The lighthouse is at ( , ).

What is the missing number in this sequence?

393   384   375   ?   357
How many of the small triangles will fill the hexagon?

Iveta was 1.43 metres tall. She grew 2 centimetres more.

How tall was she then in metres?
What fraction of the whole shape is shaded?

Write the correct number in the box:

123 ÷ __ = 123

The jug holds 1 litre of water. The jar is filled from the jug.

How much water will be left in the jug?

This chart shows how Kai spent his spare time last week.

How many hours did he spend out of doors (playing football, fishing and cycling)?

Wendy saved £2.50 a week.

How many weeks did it take her to save £20?
How many small squares will fit into the large rectangle?
Which of these digital alarm clocks shows that it is quarter past seven in the evening?

Matthew thinks of a number. He multiplies his number by 2. Then he subtracts 4. The answer is 10.

What number did Matthew first think of?

A train left at 10.20 and arrived at 11.15.

How long did the journey take, in minutes?

Mrs Ward wants to join Heritage with her three children, aged 10, 12 and 15.

How much must she pay?
About how much does an ordinary mug hold?
Which of these is NOT a quadrilateral?

Here is part of a train timetable:

A train leaves East Croydon at 23:27. How long does it take to get to Victoria?
What percentage of £5 is 50p?

The graph shows the weight of a baby girl in the first 8 weeks of her life.

How old was she at the end of the week in which she gained most weight?
Which of these shapes is NOT a cuboid?
Look at the angle shown. Which statement is correct?

options.text: Angle x is less than 90 degrees.
Angle x is a right angle.
Angle x is more than 180 degrees.
Angle x is between 90 and 180 degrees.

questions.question:
105 ÷ ? = 21

What number does ? stand for?

A swimming pool charges £3.60 for entry. You can save 1/3 of the entry fee with a membership card. On his first visit, Ken spends £5 on a membership card plus the reduced entry fee.

How many times does Ken visit before he gets back his £5?
A boy delivered newspapers and was paid £1.40 for every 100 papers. How much was he paid for delivering 250 papers?
The graph shows the population of Britain from 1700. In which year was the population twice as much as it was in 1800?
A bag had 36 sweets in it. Ethan took out 2/3 of them. How many sweets did he take out?
A ship travels 528 nautical miles in one day. How many nautical miles does it travel in 15 days?

9   36   81

The three numbers above are alike in some ways. Select ONE statement to describe how they are alike.

options.text: They can all be divided by 2 without a remainder.

questions.question: Mateo's temperature is 37.5 degrees C. When he was ill it rose by 3 degrees C. What was his temperature when he was ill?

Put these fractions in order of size, starting with the largest first.

3/4   5/8   1/2   7/8   1/4
Ava had 5 boxes and each box weighed 800 grams. How many kilograms was this altogether?
What is 3^2?
There were 27 children in a class and twice as many boys as girls. How many boys were there?
What is 60% of 50?
Look at the Venn diagram showing multiples of 3 and 4. Which number could go in the shaded section?
Work out XXVI multiplied by XLI.
Which letter on the number line is pointing at 1250?
A frog starts jumping from the middle of a circular pond that is 12 metres across. Each jump in the same direction halves his distance from the edge. How far is the frog from the edge after 3 jumps?
Zac starts with the number 5. Which of these instructions does NOT give him an answer of 17?

options.text: Halve your value, add six, then double.
Multiply by four, then subtract three.
Triple your value, then add two.
Multiply by ten, subtract sixteen, then halve.

questions.question: This chart shows the weather for 12 hours on one day. How many hours was it dry?
Put the correct number in the box: 27 × 99 = 2700 – ?
The chart shows the proportions of children in a class who go to school using various forms of transport. There are 28 children in total. Which form of transport is taken by a total of 4 children?
Ali and his sister share a pizza cut into six equal pieces. Ali eats 1/3 of all the pieces. His sister eats 1/4 of the remaining pieces. After they have eaten, what fraction of the pizza is left?

Instructions for roasting meat:
- Cook for 30 minutes at 230 degrees C.
- Turn down the heat to 180 degrees C.
- Allow 30 minutes cooking time for every 450 g.

If a piece of meat takes 2 1/2 hours altogether to cook, how heavy is it?
To make brown paint, you mix 2 parts red, 17 parts yellow and 1 part blue. How much red paint is needed to make 40 litres of brown paint?
How many 10p coins can I get for £1.80?

This bar chart shows during which months the children in a class have their birthdays.

During which month are there most birthdays?
Change the order of the figures 6085 to make the biggest number possible.

The time in New York is 5 hours behind the time in London.

In London it is 9 am.

What time is it in New York?
What are the coordinates of A?

Write this number in figures:

eight thousand and twenty-five

Share 240 into 4 equal parts.

How much is one part?
What fraction of this circle is shaded?
In the number 836, what does the 3 stand for?

What number would go in the box?

3/4 = __/8

Sati records how many children visit the school library each day.

This is the bar chart Sati draws to show her data.

How many children visited the library over the five days?

Three pieces of wood are cut from a plank 1 metre long.

Each piece is 30 cm long.

How long is the piece left over?

These three angles fit together to make a straight line:

Look at the angle below.

How many of these 30° angles will fit together to make a straight line?

Callum is thinking of a two-digit number.

Its digits add up to 5.
It is a prime number.
Its square is a three-digit number.

What number is he thinking of?

What is the next number in this sequence?

49   43   37   31   ______

The thermometer shows the temperature in Kiev.

London is 18° C warmer.

What is the temperature in London?

Look at these bottles.

How many times would you have to fill the 250 ml bottle to make 1 litre?

There were 24 marbles in a bag.

I took out 1/3 of the marbles.

How many marbles did I take out?

Karen wants to buy a guitar.

She has saved £43.95
The guitar costs £65.00

How much more money does she need?

Put these numbers in order from the smallest to the biggest.

0.525   0.7   0.35   0.175

8 chocolate bars cost £5.20.

How much do 6 chocolate bars cost?
What is 50% of 40?

The bar chart shows the heights of a class of pupils.

Which statement MUST be true?

options.text: 5 children have a height between 120 cm and 129 cm.
No children have a height less than 111 cm.
7 children have a height more than 140 cm but less than 150 cm.
8 children have a height of less than 139 cm.

questions.question:
A television programme finished at 4.55 pm.

It lasted for three-quarters of an hour.

At what time did it start?
Which of these moves is not a translation?

Zoey has a large carpet in her room.

It is 5 metres long and 4 metres wide.

What is the distance all around the edge of the carpet?

Ella paid £780 per month in rent.

How much rent did she pay in 12 months?

Jenny is wallpapering her bedroom.

She starts with a 6 metre roll but has to cut off 1.75 metres because it is damaged.
If she needs 33.75 metres of wallpaper in total, how many more rolls of 6 metres must she buy?

An empty box weighs 150 grams.

When it is filled with paper it weighs 1 kilogram.

How much does the paper weigh?

Mrs Shaw has 175 ml of liquid.

She needs a container for it.

Which one suits her needs best?

The vertices of the two squares below are labelled with letters.

Which of the following lines is perpendicular to the line connecting P and R?

options.text: the line connecting X and Y
the line connecting P and S
the line connecting Q and S
the line connecting S and W
the line connecting Q and R

questions.question: If X stands for a whole number and 3 lots of X are equal to 36, what are 2 lots of X equal to?

A rectangle is drawn with corner A at (1, 1).

All sides of the rectangle are then doubled in length.

The new rectangle is drawn with A again at (1, 1).

Where will corner C now be drawn?
Which of these statements is NOT true for this regular hexagon?

options.text: There is only 1 pair of parallel sides.

questions.question:
Emily has six sticks.

Their lengths are: 3 cm, 5 cm, 6 cm, 8 cm, 9 cm, 11 cm

Emily can lay the sticks end to end to make triangles.

Emily wants to make the smallest triangle she can using the 11 cm stick.

Which two other lengths of stick should she use?

Muhammed must get up at 07.30 hours.

He goes to bed at 22.38 hours the night before.

How long does he spend in bed?

Liam carried ten parcels.

Each parcel weighed 250 grams.

How many KILOGRAMS was this altogether?

This graph converts British Pounds (£) to United States Dollars ($).

How many Dollars ($) is £34?

To add up all the angles inside a polygon, you subtract 2 from the number of sides and multiply this by 180.

An octagon has 8 sides.

What do the angles inside an octagon add up to?

The bar chart shows the amount of money Lewis, Jordan and Zoe have in their savings accounts.

Which one of these is NOT true?

options.text: Lewis has half as much as Jordan.
Zoe has twice as much as Lewis.

questions.question:
The end points of five lines are shown in the answer options below.

Which line is parallel to the line in the diagram?
What is the area of this rectangle?
What is 1.7 as a fraction?

Greg thinks of a number, multiplies it by 3, subtracts 5 and then multiplies by 2.

His answer is 26.

What number did Greg think of?

Henry says that to change from kilometres to miles you divide the number of kilometres by 8 and then multiply by 5.

Which of these is NOT correct?

A shape, PQRS is shown on a coordinate grid.

Following a reflection, the position of point S in the reflected shape is (6, 1).

In what line is the shape reflected?

options.text: A horizontal line that passes through the y-axis at (0, 6)
A vertical line that passes through the x-axis at (5, 0)
A horizontal line that passes through the y-axis at (0, 5)
A horizontal line that passes through the y-axis at (0, 4)
A vertical line that passes through the x-axis at (6, 0)

questions.question:
The area of a rectangular playground is 210 metres squared.

Which of the following could be the playground's perimeter?
4³ × 4 × 3² is NOT the same as which of the following?
